adjectives.description: indictable (comparative more indictable, superlative most indictable)

entries.meaning: (of an act) Subjecting one to an indictment.
examples: Do not then charge men as too strict or precise, when they endeavour to abstain from idle thoughts and idle words, that they dare not give themselves that licence which others take, for these are indictable as well as great sins;

entries.meaning: (of a person) Able or deserving to be indicted.
